materials.raw_text: B: 16 g, Co: 4 g, Tm: 1 g, Zr: 3 g

sourcing.instructions: B (Boron) - Chemical supply stores or online suppliers; Co (Cobalt) - Metal suppliers or online; Tm (Thulium) - Specialty chemical suppliers; Zr (Zirconium) - Metal suppliers or online.
steps: B (Boron) - Chemical supply stores or online suppliers; Co (Cobalt) - Metal suppliers or online; Tm (Thulium) - Specialty chemical suppliers; Zr (Zirconium) - Metal suppliers or online.

1. Measure 16 g of Boron powder, 4 g of Cobalt powder, 1 g of Thulium powder, and 3 g of Zirconium powder using a precise scale. 2. Combine all measured powders in a clean, dry mixing bowl. 3. Use a spatula to mix thoroughly until a homogeneous blend is achieved, ensuring even distribution of all components. 4. Transfer the mixture to a ball mill and mill for 2 hours to enhance homogeneity.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 16 g of Boron powder, 4 g of Cobalt powder, 1 g of Thulium powder, and 3 g of Zirconium powder using a precise scale. 2. Combine all measured powders in a clean, dry mixing bowl. 3. Use a spatula to mix thoroughly until a homogeneous blend is achieved, ensuring even distribution of all components. 4. Transfer the mixture to a ball mill and mill for 2 hours to enhance homogeneity.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200°C. 2. Place the milled powder mixture in a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and maintain the temperature for 4 hours to facilitate sintering.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200°C. 2. Place the milled powder mixture in a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and maintain the temperature for 4 hours to facilitate sintering.

steps: 1. After the heating duration is complete, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool inside the furnace to room temperature (approximately 1-2 hours) to prevent thermal shock. 3. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration is complete, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool inside the furnace to room temperature (approximately 1-2 hours) to prevent thermal shock. 3. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible and inspect for any rough edges or imperfections. 2. If necessary, use a diamond file to smooth out the surface. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant suitable for the material to enhance durability. 4. Allow the sealant to cure for 24 hours before using the sample.
